relation: Do all that you can to pass classes and take advantage of tutors and other resources.
Aims Community College is a good place to start off for college since it is cheaper. The atmosphere is overall good and classes are easy to find. The faculty and staff are very helpful as well.
pageTitle: Aims Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {254678=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 15489=Aims is very reasonabley priced. So far both semesters have been under $1000 for me. It is a great two year college., 230253=There is many events scheduled that are for students and sometimes for the families of students too. For example to kick off the Fall 2013 semester there is a Fall in bbq for students and their families.}

textAfterTable: Bang for the buck It is most definitely worth your money since most of the classes transfer to pretty much any university. The classes are more one-on-one with the teachers, so you can actually get more out of your hard-earned money!! Am enjoying being here I am very much enjoying my time here. I did not think I would start off at a community college, but the thought of attending a 25,000 student university scrared me. Aims is the step between high school and a university. It makes for an easier transition and you make great friends, since the college is relatively small. Am learning a lot The classes are Aims are very small, so you can grasp alot more from the class. The teachers are always available and ready to help! Login to rate or flag the reviews Xavier from Evans, CO 02/17/2012 Reviewer is A current student here. 2 out of 2 people found this review useful. 2 of 67
